intro: Agraulus alpinus, commonly known as the Alpine leafhopper, is a small insect belonging to the family Cicadellidae. It is characterized by its slender body and distinctive coloration, often featuring a mix of green, brown, and white patterns. This species is typically found in alpine and mountainous regions where it feeds on the sap of various flowering plants. Its wings are delicate and often transparent, allowing it to blend with its environment. Agraulus alpinus plays a minor role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat, primarily as a herbivorous insect.
